ygData.subject: Re: Mesmerize
ygData.msgSnippet: I m not positive but I think I observed this once accidentally on a Gnoll. I ll try it tonight if I can get people to leave it alone long enough for Mes to
ygData.messageBody:
I'm not positive but I think I observed this once accidentally on a Gnoll.
I'll try it tonight if I can get people to leave it alone long enough for
Mes to wear off <grin>.

-----Original Message-----
From: HiFi Review [mailto:hifireview@...]
Sent: Friday, May 28, 1999 10:25 AM
To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Mesmerize


From: HiFi Review <hifireview@...>

The rat may not have a long duration on the hate list. It's possible
that different monsters have differing memory lengths. have you tried
this same experiment on a higher level mob?

--- dean_witcraft@... wrote:
> From: dean_witcraft@...
>
> Subject: Re: stacking
>
> >not quite. Mesmerize stuns ( any attack will unstun
> ) and mixes the hate
> >list of the target, but does not remove it like
> memory blur.
> >Skara <Elite> on Innoruuk
>
>
> Try this:
> Stash your weapon (use your fists). Hit a low level
> mob (I used a non-agressive rat). The rat will
> turn and attack you. Cast mesmerize, stop your
> attack and back away.
>
> When I did this, the rat eventually woke up and just
>
> walked right by me. This seems to me to indicate
> that I was cleared from his 'hate list'.
>
> Anybody have any other explanation for this?
>
>
>
